column4: do i need a particular version of ubuntu for my laptop - it is core duo 2

ubntu 6.0.6
what about Dapper or Edgy
check the HCL on the site
HCL?
darn it only goes up to IBM R52, mine is R60e
i'll have to try suse. They tend to work on laptops better than ubuntu
someone telling you that is ill-informed
ahhh.. maybe just a ubuntu hater
no just ill-informed
still in beta
release candidates, or straight to final
depends on your needs/setup/config
it may not work at ll
gmail isn't an application, its a webpage
do you know how to set it to gmail to send links rather than evolution though?
I would try replacing it with the gmail link for the "launcher" url
gmail link? like the whole line?
the line for the launcher
there is not
why ?
there is no plans - so it doesn't matter
thats your opionion, which your welcome to
sorry, i thought it was a well-known fact
no, it's not. It's your opinion only
not just mine.... a lot of people say it is a fact
more so it's not - so by your logic your wrong
most biffs can only do one account
better?
you'd need to do absoulte paths
as the launcher runs from the desktops cwd
what and how do i do an absolute path?
for example /usr/bin/jar xvf /home/mr_user/myfile.jar
thats an absoulte path for the binary and the path to the jar file
so if the file is in my home directory i do /usr/home/livingdaylight ï»¿java -jar cgoban.jar ?
no, re-read the example I gave you
absoulte paths to the binary and the file
/usr/bin/jar xvf /home/user/javfile.jar
usr/bin/jar xvf /home/livingdaylight/cgoban.jat
that looks better
failed to execute child process /usr/bin/jar no such file directory
i did it, but it turned out to be easier than imagined
instead of that really long command, simply: java -jar /pathto/cgoban.jar
you can't
it's a clean install needed
damn.... too late... i thought i read one could upgrade without reformatting
on what version
lucid
looks like it's outdated already
mplayer?
smplayer
there is a newer version?
I've not looked, but that warning sugggests so
why does smplayer complain bout a lack of the newest version of Mplyer rather than let me know that a newer version of smplayer is available. That smplayer is outdated rather than Mplayer?
I don't know, ask the smplayer developers
that warning suggests that Mplayer is outdated
where/how do i ask the smplayer developers?
look on the webpage for contact details
no
people are under no obligation to do anything

its just funny how people like to respond if someone is 'out of line' but ask nicely a million times and one get ignored - can be frustrating. Of course no one is under any obligation to do anything - I understand
not at all, people are busy being helped
but youre not helping me?
I'm helping other people
you're busy telling me that you're helping other people
then I best get back to helping other people
are you helping lots of people still?
have you told 10.04 to offer none-lts releases ?
i don't recall telling it anything
uname -a please
thx
try ##hardware
having a problem with multiple OS's, same symptoms, probably a hardware issue
yea, probably, Ubuntu and xubuntu [fresh install today] Firefox seems to trigger it. But ran chrome came back and had to reboot too
ok - so both ubuntu based though
have you considered doing a base hardware check, such as memtest
yes *buntu based 100%
that's why I am asking because I don't know what I can do. hardwqare check such as memtest?
I'd suggest a little hardware test, run memcheck for a good few hours, and use a tool called "stress Linux" for a good few hours, just test your hardware to get an idea that is't supported
can you please tell me how?
not familiar with either
memtest is in the ubuntu boot menu, select it from grub run it for 12 - 14 hours or so at least, any errors in your ram will show up
is stress test in repositories? where is this tool?
stress linux is a livecd
it's a bit of a drag as it will waste 24 hours of your life, however it's worth it to get a bit of confidence your hardware is ok

well, this has more than wasted 24hrs of my life already. Its a real drag, coz I not long ago got a new hd. Admittedly the machine is relatively old now, although still a dual-core. Nevertheless, I don't know what I can and can't keep and whether to just get a new base unit. If this can diagnose the problem so at least I know whehter I can salvage my system or not I can move forward
run the tests I've suggested, that may give you an idea to any possible hardware problems, we can move forward from there
it's worth while
http://www.stresslinux.org/sl/ these guys, yes?
that's the stuff
thx
thank!

when I installed Ubuntu there was an option to install 3rd party proprietary codecs etc, which I enabled, so, not sure why I have to go round finding all the bits and bobs to make my system multimedia working
there are options to enable other repos, but you can follow that guide to add the repos/packages you need
